info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 12:57PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lewis and Clark and western Teton Counties through 130 PM MDT... At 1255 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms northwest of Augusta, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pendroy, Nilan Reservoir, Pishkun Reservoir and Bynum. This includes Highway 89 between mile markers 52 and 67. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for north central and west central Montana.
